channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3746] How LOST should've ended (GIF)
[+2693] Cool knows no barriers (PIC)
item.description: M. Lambrechts took this picture at a gay pride parade in Brussels 2009.This was a little kid of a gay couple coming to check those curious pins on his jackets He pulled the punks jacket and the punk went sitting on his knees, when the 2 men called their kid back the punk got a little kiss from the kid :)

item.title: [+2467] Oh - TEXAS...(Pic)
[+2304] Classy: Fox Erases Applause from Obama's West Point Speech
item.description: Fox News, Obama. I guess there is nothing else to say. Stay classy Fox News.

item.title: [+2071] Dog Surprises Officer After Being Freed From A Fence
item.description: Wait 'til the end... it's worth it.

item.title: [+1607] The great Roger Ebert KILLS Sex and the City 2 [review]
item.description: First sentence: "Some of these people make my skin crawl." And it just gets better (or worse, depending on your perspective) from there.

item.title: [+1600] Damnit Scyther...
[+1213] Apple Passes Microsoft as World’s Largest Tech Company
item.description: What a long, strange trip it’s been. Apple’s market capitalization officially passed Microsoft’s this afternoon, making the Cupertino company, for the first time, the largest technology company in the world.

item.title: [+1201] Baby Eats First Pop Rocks
item.description: Baby eats a pop rock for the first time. The reaction is priceless.

item.title: [+1101] The RIP: Brand Name vs. Generic Drugs (Graphic)
item.description: There’s a reason they’re trusted brands and, you expect, you’re getting higher-quality ingredients, product safety and, best of all, a much more efficient cure for just a small premium in price. This is exactly the thinking that leads most people to overspend on medications by as much as 80%.

item.title: [+1061] Meanwhile, in Japan... [sfw]
[+839] "Lost" Finale: ABC Added Final Images, Not Producers
item.description: Turns out that ABC - and not executive producers Damon Lindelof and Carlton Cuse - threw that scene in there as a “visual aid” to ease the transition from the emotional ending of the series finale to the 11 p.m. news.

item.title: [+808] The 50 Hottest Cougars Over 40 (PICS)
item.description: With plastic surgery and better knowledge of how to take care of our bodies women are staying hot much farther into life. Read on for our list of the 50 hottest women over 40 and prepare to be amazed!

item.title: [+800] Hero Shopkeeper Saves Falling Toddler [VID]
item.description: A hero has saved a four-year-old boy who fell from the top of an escalator, in Turkey, almost certainly saving his life.

item.title: [+768] Beer2D2 [PIC]
item.description: Heineken has made the best keg ever. Consisting of 4.7 liters worth of beer and standing 16 inches tall, this keg is pure win. Photo was taken at the San Jose Super Toy Show.

item.title: [+646] The Case for Socialism
item.description: Capitalism isn’t working. Not in the US and not in other parts of the world. In fact, virtually anywhere one goes, suffering is pervasive. Almost half the world’s population - more than three billion people, the equivalent of the population of ten United States - live on less than $2.50 a day. A billion people are undernourished...

item.title: [+629] Justice Dep't Says Az Immigration Law is Unconstitutional
item.description: The Department of Justice said Arizona's immigration law is unconstitutional on the grounds that the state has overstepped it's authority and because the law has potential for abuse. A team of Justice Department attorneys has written a recommendation challenging the Arizona immigration law....

item.title: [+561] Time Warner Cable Resists Mass BitTorrent Lawsuit
item.description: A consortium of independent film producers is hitting a stumbling block in its plan to simultaneously sue thousands of BitTorrent users for allegedly downloading pirated movies. Time Warner Cable is refusing to look up and turn over the identities of about a thousand of its customers targeted in the lawsuits...

item.title: [+559] Eating Out: From Bad to Worse (Infographic)
item.description: When you take a look at the calories, sodium, and fat on some popular restaurant items, it's amazing to see so many meals break 4-digits in calories and 3-digits in fat. Perhaps the KFC Double Down isn't so bad afterall.

item.title: [+552] The 50 Prettiest Porn Stars of All Time [SFW]
